summary: The 1936 Summer Olympics were held in Berlin, Germany. Germany built a huge stadium and other venues to host the Games. It was the first Olympics to be televised. Adolf Hitler used the event to promote his ideas of racial supremacy. Jewish athletes were not allowed to participate. The United States won the most gold medals, but Germany won the most overall. The Games were the last before World War II, with the next ones held in 1948.
title: 1936 Summer Olympics
